org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint

Class AngleJoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.dynamics.Constraint
      • org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint.Joint
        • org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint.AngleJoint

  • public class AngleJoint
extends Joint
    Represents a angle joint.

    A angle joint constrains the relative rotation between [-π, π].

    NOTE: The getAnchor1() and getAnchor2() methods return the world space center points for the joined bodies.

    Defaults the min and max angles to the current angle (allowing no angular movement).

    The joint limits must match the following restrictions:

    • lower limit ≤ upper limit
    • lower limit ≥ -180
    • upper limit ≤ 180
    To create a joint with limits other than this format use the setReferenceAngle(double) method. For example: 
     // we would like the joint limits to be [30, 260]
 // this is the same as the limits [-60, 170] if the reference angle is 90
 angleJoint.setLimits(Math.toRadians(-60), Math.toRadians(170));
 angleJoint.setReferenceAngle(Math.toRadians(90));
    The angle joint also allows a ratio value that allow the bodies to rotate at a specified value relative to the other. This can be used to simulate gears.

    Since the AngleJoint class defaults the upper and lower limits to the same value and by default the limits are enabled, you will need to modify the limits, or disable the limit to see the effect of the ratio.

    When the angle between the bodies reaches a limit, if limits are enabled, the ratio is effectively turned off.

    Since:
    2.2.2
    Version:
    3.1.0
    Author:
    William Bittle

      • shiftCoordinates

        protected void shiftCoordinates(Vector2 shift)
        Description copied from class: Constraint
        Shifts (translates) the coordinates of this constraint.

        Typically this method should not be called directly. Instead use the World.shiftCoordinates(Vector2) method to move the entire world.

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        double
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • setRatio

        public void setRatio(double ratio)
        Sets the angular velocity ratio between the two bodies.

        To disable the ratio and fix their velocities set the ratio to 1.0.

        The ratio can be negative to reverse the direction of the velocity of the other body.

        Parameters:
        ratio - the ratio
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • getReferenceAngle

        public double getReferenceAngle()
        Returns the reference angle.

        The reference angle is the angle calculated when the joint was created from the two joined bodies. The reference angle is the angular difference between the bodies.

        Returns:
        double
        Since:
        3.0.1

      • setReferenceAngle

        public void setReferenceAngle(double angle)
        Sets the reference angle.

        This method can be used to set the reference angle to override the computed reference angle from the constructor. This is useful in recreating the joint from a current state.

        See the class documentation for more details.

        Parameters:
        angle - the reference angle in radians
        Since:
        3.0.1
        See Also:
        getReferenceAngle()
